text: Would love to say great service but unfortunately I never received their service. I called and setup service to pump out RV the week before Christmas and was told they'd be out the following week. I waited and never received a call or a visit. I called the next week and was told that he forgot to dispatch the information. I reiterated the need for the pumping as we had holiday guests and really who wants to ask their guests to do their business in the woods. I was told they would be out Thursday. On Wednesday my 13 year old and I put gravel going to the RV to make sure the truck wouldn't get stuck with heavy rains. Not exactly a fun chore. On Thursday I called to see when the service truck would arrive only to be told that it wouldn't be this week at all. I explained that this had inconvenienced me, 13 year old, and a 91 year old and I would like to know exactly when they will provide the service. Chad then proceeded to tell me essentially.....we were out of his way. At this point I've decided to go elsewhere. Horrible customer service, lack of concern, and apparently unable to show up. If your looking for someone to get the job done you might have to call someone else just like I have too.

So i had my husband call him and he tells my husband "oh all of my guys are gone home, it will be monday". Which he was told from get go that it needed done by friday. The guy scheduled me for that day because he wasn't busy and he came right out to the house. Super nice guy. He looked at our tank and explained to me what size I had and how many and gave me a quote before he started any work. Great communicator! He and his brother did a quality service. You can pay cash, check or card. He had a glitch with his new square reader but I helped him figure it out and then he got excited and we started laughing about it. All in all it was a great experience. Quality service, a very timely manner, quality work, great prices! What more can you ask for!? He recommended me to someone that got the job done very quickly. Mr. Caples told me that if I had any more issues that it had to be my field lines. Nine months later I had water in my basement and I reached out to him again. Without missing a beat he knew exactly who I was and set up an appointment with me. He came out and fix the problem. Now we're six months in and everything is working great. I appreciate the way that Mr. Cappels handled my situation. Instead of charging me an arm and a leg to replace everything all at once he pumped by septic tank first and then we waited to see if that was it or if more needed to be done. name: Lillie Shepard
text: I had previously used Weaver Septic for a bad smell in our house after it rained and they capped our septic tank. We had to call over and over for 5 weeks to get them to come back and finish the job by capping the tank after their first visit. When the problem kept happening we called them again and they wouldn’t come out for several days, so we contacted Ultimate Plumbing and Septic who were able to come out the very next day. Brian was able to fix a pipe under our house that had a hole in it and five minutes after he left Trey called and came over to check out the septic tank. He immediately diagnosed the problem, which was the job done by Weaver. They had not sealed the caps to the tank or bolted them down, but only placed it down and covered it with dirt. This was allowing water to flood our tank every time it rained. Trey from Ultimate was able to replace caps and properly seal them and also fix an issue with the pipe leading to the tank. I couldn’t have asked for anyone to be more reliable, honest, trustworthy, and hardworking than Brian and Trey. I would strongly encourage anyone needing plumbing or septic services to give these guys a call. I could only give them a 5/5, but they are definitely a 10/10. Would highly recommend!!

As a result, I will definitely use and highly recommend Ultimate Plumbing for any future plumbing issues based on my experience with them. My plumber Brian and his helper were awesome!  They were totally professional, courteous, and very helpful in answering my questions. I was impressed by the quality and efficiency of their workmanship in replacing my sewer line. I am totally pleased!  Thank you Ultimate Plumbing and Septic Services  for providing good old fashioned customer service. I don't usually give reviews but I just had to applaud this company. name: Beverly Hogan
text:
After scheduling an appointment to occur between a designated 4 hour time span, I offered for the technician.plumber to attend to a problem closer to his current location. While he cannot help that he encountered a mess and that it was me who invited him to out my appointment off til later, I never heard back from him as promised. When I reached out to their office receptionist/customer service specialist, they apologized but did not offer me a "make-up" appointment. Rather, they indicated they were scheduling people (customers calling after my missed appointment) already into the following Tuesday and it would be after that date. They told me they had been scheduling others since my appointment and it would be 2-3 days before they could work me back in. I would rather bail buckets of water to my back porch for the rest of the week than do business with a company that accepts this as customer service. Thus, I cancelled my interest in following through with the repairs. There was also an issue with price discrepancy. The web listed free estimates. It seemed reasonable however they would charge $60.00 to come from the Gadsden to Leeds area but the technician indicated it would be $89.00. He did offer to honor the price but it was dishonored by not showing up or calling. It is of course unclear if this was the intent. I will say they were all very nice if you just want to talk to nice and seemingly knowledgeable people about plumbing.

Addendum: "I see that a reply has been offered by the owner, "I'm sorry, call and we will make it right" Before spending more time talking about the idea of services, I would need to know how this would be made right. For instance, if I have received the repairs elsewhere (since this was well over a month ago), will I receive some reimbursement for such? I cannot imagine someone being so generous as to do such a thing.
Or if I have not had the repairs done, will I receive an offer no one could possibly refuse in exchange for the prior bad service. Maybe if I have an idea about whether the call is worthwhile vs a pre-scripted customer service response, I might call. Thanks for responding though.

resp.text: We are sorry for the misunderstanding. Please give us a call & we will make it right! Thank you.

text:
DO NOT HIRE THIS COMPANY! They were hired to connect a trailer to septic after the trailer was moved.  None of the "drops"  were connected.  Both toilets drained on the ground. The sinks drained on the ground. No one can figure out what they actually connected to, but they did connect something to the septic tank. It may be the electrical conduit, but it certainly is NOT plumbing that the septic line is connected! The entire system will have to be redone. Thousands of dollars wasted. Two different companies said this job was improperly done, and that we should try to get our money back.
REPLY TO reply: BEFORE you bid the job and were hired,  it was explained to your technician what work needed to be done by a professional that moved Mobile Homes and knew what needed to be done.  His advise was ignored.  The reason I lifted the STOP PAYMENT on the check was on the council  of an attorney, who explained that by signing your document without truly understanding that the job on the contract was NOT the job I  had hired you to do, I was now legally bound. I should have known when you threatened to bill my elderly mother-in-law for a "FREE ESTIMATE",  I was making a mistake. I will be contacting the Better Business Bureau to see if they can warn others about your Ultimate "Plumbing" and Septic Services, sir, and, unlike you, am a man of my word.

resp.text:
Sir, you moved a trailer that had no plumbing. There is plastic underneath the trailer with a plumbing connection. You hired us to run a main line from the trailer to the septic tank. You didn’t hire us to repipe the trailer. After the job was completed you called us back to tell us that you also wanted us to repipe the trailer. We offered to come back and do that but it wasn’t within the price of the job we already done. On our invoice we wrote down all that needed to be done. We stated that all we done was run a main line from the trailer to the tank. We are sorry for the misunderstanding & if you would please give us a call we would love to make things right. Thank you!

Reply: Your mother wanted us to come out and run a new line from the house to the tank. We came out at 8pm & stayed for 2 hours trying to find the tank. We brought our equipment to complete the job. After we done that she wanted to wait so we charged her $60. We are sorry you think that is over priced. Thank you.

I reviewed your invoice from 12-5-2019. You were given 2 options.

Option A: Install 180ft of field lines.
Option B: Install an aerator

You chose the aerator for financial reasons. We offered to take 50% off of the price. On the invoice you signed it says customers choice. As we discussed on 12-5-2019 your field lines were in bad shape & this aerator would only give you a little more life. It helped for 10 months which was about the estimated life we predicted they would last until you decided to replace the lines. I’m sorry about your experience ma’am & if you give us a call we would be more than happy to come back out and help. Thank you ma’am!

name: Valerie Johnson
text:
My husband and I moved to the Jefferson County area in December 2020. During the process of buying our home, our realtor agent had set up a septic system inspection with Absolute Environmental. They came out on December 17, 2020. They performed the inspection and found that a few repairs were needed. They quoted the repairs and we told them that we would call them back to perform the repairs once the closing was completed. Our yard was left a mess by Absolute as we we had an understanding they'd be back to finish the job. My husband called them on Friday, March 12 and left a message for a return call and again on Monday, March 15th. Today is March 20th. We have yet to hear from them. We didnt foresee contacting them and getting them out here would be a problem. We needed our lines cleared asap as they were backed up. They didnt step up.  They clearly showed bad business ethic!!
At the end of the business day on Monday, March 15th, we decided to contact a different company. We're very happy with our experience with the other company we went with. We got a call back from them in less than an hour. We had our first issue resolved in less than 24 hours. Our repair was taken care of on Friday, March 19th. The cost was very reasonable!! They responded back quickly, very friendly, professional and did an awesome job taking care of us and our issues,  considering we were new customers!!
Absolute Environmental will never have our business. No return phone call after leaving 2 voice messages is bad business!! We dont know how they get a 4.8 star review on Google!! 🤨👎🙄😒😣😖👎

resp.text: We are sorry, but during the times you called, we had closed due to a death, again we are sorry.

I was told it would be fixed, and I have called them 8 times since, which I have proof of, with no fix. They would always say they would call me back, sometimes didn't pick up, and then today picked up and hung up. So for 2 weeks this water has been sitting there, the entire ground is mush, and I know this is damaging the system that I paid for. One would think for this amount of money they would be willing to correct this issue or at least do something. Realtors, Property Investors, and Homeowners should be wary of this company.

text: We bought our house recently and the sellers were supposed to have the septic tank replaced before signing.  Because of problems with sellers and inspector dragging feet it was not possible. Because of weather and other issues getting it done as quick as originally agreed on was not possible. It was starting to worry me if it would be done at all.   Bo however did come out personally as promised and went above and beyond to take care of our problem.  So as far as being skeptical about him and his company because of other reviews, don’t. He is a man of his word that takes pride in his work.  He won’t break rules or cut corners. He believes in exceptional work and expects nothing less than that from his employees.   I saw where people said he was rude and had a temper.  I disagree.  All he ask is you show him respect for what he does and he will show you the same.   He is a very nice person as long as you take a second and realize you chose him for his expertise not the other way around(or you would be doing the job yourself).  I knew nothing about septic systems before today as this was my first house with it and Bo and his staff took plenty of time to explain in great, yet simple and easy terminology, about how it works and what to expect.  So with this.  Thank you Bo for the exceptional work and wonderful knowledge.   I look forward to using you for all my septic needs and highly recommend absolute environmental services to anyone needing this time of work done.

text:
Our family was faced with the devastating news that our old septic system was broken and unrepairable. Not knowing who to turn to our daughter heard about Bo Header and Absolute Environmental Plumbing. We knew nothing about septic systems, but he walked us through the entire process and we had complete confidence in him. His knowledge of septic systems and the history of them throughout our community gave us the assurance that we had picked the right company.

After all of the testing and acquiring of permits Bo and his team began work and had the plumbing in and working within 3 days. I could not believe it. After weeks of waiting we were ‘reconnected to the world’ and we could not be happier. His team was very professional, cordial and respectful of the impact that this project was having on our family.

I hope I never have to deal with this problem again in life, but If I do, and AEP is anywhere in the area, they are who I will call.

name: Robert Amaro
text: I've used these folks twice now.  Two years ago, directly after purchasing a house that had sat dormant for 3+ years, the septic system decided to act up.  The Tice's came out late at night and found out that my tank was 100% overgrown with tree roots (reminded me of the scene in the Creep Show episode with the meteor).  They pumped down the tank immediately so that we could shower, and within a week they had come out and completely cleaned out the root system (chainsaw work INSIDE my tanks).  They did an amazing amount of work for a great price.  Yesterday, the old system started acting up again.  They came out first thing this morning so we could shower for work.  As we had suspected 2 years ago, the roots had gotten into the drain system as well. Absolutely amazing folks! Will always use them.

text: Two Saturdays ago My wife and I noticed that our toilets weren't flushing correctly and there was water in our tubs and showers. I called multiple septic services with no luck. He did give me a couple of things I could trouble shoot in the meantime. I probably called him five times and each time he would patiently walk me through the details, as I am not mechanically inclined. He even called to check on me twice to see if anything had worked. We were finally able to get all the water out of the tubs and toilets working again. The first of the week they came and pumped my tank. I can't think of anyone who would have been so kind and helpful, all while being so covered up with other jobs. The customer service was impeccable. I even had Blake on speaker phone once , and when we hung up my wife said "aww he's sweet." Maybe the first time that's ever been said about the septic guy lol. I recommend this company to anyone needing this type of work, and will definitely use again in the future.

text: CONSUMER BEWARE!!! I was given an 8-10am window to have a septic inspection this morning. Got to property at 8am for inspection, waited till 9 and decided to call. Lady at office acted like I was bothering her and assured me that someone would be there inside said window. Then 9:50 I called back and she said she would call and check, called me back and said her techs had been on a job since before my scheduled time and would be over an hour late and told me that until someone called and said they were on the way that I shouldn’t expect them to be there in the time frame I was given. A simple courtesy call to say “hey we’ve knowingly been stuck on a job since 7am and are going to be late getting to you”could’ve solved whole issue. I run a service company too and if I did business this way I would be going out of business. This company doesn’t value their customers, the fact that the largest purchase a lot of people make in life is riding on their inspection, and they don’t value your time. Because of their neglect to inform the customer of their inability to uphold the appointment they set now my 10day inspection period is coming to a close with no spec to inspection, I’ve personally lost a whole days wages, and my employee has lost a days worth of wages as well. The impact of ones actions into another’s life is often over looked because people don’t care about other and I assure you this company does not. It’s whats wrong with our country, our people, and for sure this business. If you need a septic inspection I suggest you use one of the other companies around Birmingham because this one is no good!

text: Got here on time and explained everything they were doing and why. Did not pressure me, but gave me a basic price and prices for anything extra I might want them to do. Showed me the problem and my options. Will use them again.

name: Martin Horst
text: I usually don't feel compelled to leave reviews but I do here.  Exceptionally professional and personable crew.  I am a first time homeowner and have never experienced the problems a septic system may cause.  Ignorance in the matter led me to believe that they needed servicing far more infrequently than they do.  Needless to say it was not only full, but compacted and beginning to fill into my mainline.  Also, my septic tank was positioned awkwardly between my package air unit and a shed, both of which were there when I purchased the home.  Every problem that arose was met and resolved with diligence and care.  I had my tank pumped, a new lid with a cap installed which allows easier and cheaper future maintenance (recommended), and also had to have my mainline pressure washed to remove blockages.  Each service offered was fairly priced and alternatives given, such as renting a snake and snaking the blockage out myself.  I'm glad I opted to have it pressure washed out because I don't think I would have been able to dislodge it myself.  I appreciate direct people that do no try to "upsale" at every corner.   I was shown my problems and given options on how to resolve them and informed on the pros and cons of each which allowed me to decide what I thought best for me.  Most importantly, I would like to inform home owners to spare them any problems that may be looming ahead of them.  What would typically be a 20 min job ended up being multiple hours do to the condition and location of my septic tank and also why I recommend the capped lid.  Next time it needs to be pumped all that will be needed is removal of the lid and send the hose down without having to dig into my yard which will make it significantly cheaper going forward.   Also, instead of 7 years going without service it will be done at the recommended 3.  If you have a septic tank and it hasn't been serviced in 3 years,  get it done.  Trust me, it will save you money and headaches.  Due to my experience with Drainworks I will be a customer of theirs going forward.

resp.text: Mr. Horst, thank you so much for taking the time to write your review.  We thank you for the trust you have placed in us.  We do appreciate your business!

($760) estimated to connect the gas line to the space heater which was less than 5 ft away from end cap. ($50-$125) they said will be added to the total for pulling permit and pressure test comes with the estimate. Brand new pipe alone cost more than $10. Justin has done work for me twice at my rental property and each time his work is professional and the price is fair!  I've not had to call him back for a redo of anything! He is really that good!
Carter came to my home and did some work for me on 10-6-2016 and he is just as good as Justin (that says lot!). Carter offered us options and even said that he fixed it like he'd would have at his own home.
And that folks is the thing about C&M Plumbing, they have treated each of my small projects with the care, expertise and respect that you so seldom find.
I will do business with C&M Plumbing when ever I need their services and  I highly recommend these professionals!

resp.text: Thank you for your review. It is always a pleasure to make our customers happy. We look forward to helping you in the future.

name: John Cespedes
text: They quickly came out to swap out a dying water heater. Ricky did a great job and a clean job site. I would highly recommend them.

text: I had a 30 minute conversation with this company about a plumbing need for my grandmother. We set an appointment date for the previous Thursday. No one called or showed up.

name: S Dan
text: Peter was amazing. He was very polite and on time. He was punctual and very respectful, not to mention he wore a mask upon arriving. He efficiently fixed my hot water, my leaking shower and my faucet. I’d highly recommend him to anyone needing good quality service. It’s hard to find businesses that stand by their word in these times, great to know that this company does not have that issue!

name: John Southerland
text: Josh is by far the most knowledgeable plumber I have ever dealt with. Interviewed multiple people before selecting J Henry. Josh has an incredible knowledge of how all the water systems work in and around the house, including legacy systems and current technology, where trends are headed, as well as basic repair, replace, or maintenance. He has certifications that other plumbers didn’t have, which showed us he is serious about staying current on the latest trends in various water and water heating systems. Highly recommend!

text: Plumber arrived on time and was very nice. I made the mistake of not asking how much they charge. They were recommended by a co-worker and said they were reasonable. I had 3 dripping faucets. It cost me $378!  I will never make this mistake again. Always ask for pricing. They charge by the sink, not by the hour. Unfortunately my dripping sinks were 3 separate sinks.  The last time I had a plumber in, it was $160. I feel I was gouged.  Don't make the same mistake I did!

text: Mr. Davis and his son are amazing!  I am not sure why this service isn't #1 on the list of septic tank services in Tuscaloosa. Mr. Davis should give a masterclass on quality delivered and customer service. text: I called Keith the Plumber on a Sunday with a blockage in the main sewer line between my house and the street and water backing up. If something like this should happen again in the future, my first call will be to Keith the Plumber.  Yours should be too.

name: dierdriu
text:
I am so impressed with this company.  I had a significant leak. Another plumber had given me a quote over the phone for finding the leak that I could not possibly have afforded.  I found Keith the Plumber on a Google search and gave them a call.  Wes answered my call and told me that they were booked up for the day; they'd come the next day, but they'd put me on a call list in case they finished early.  And, they did.  Roger came out and immediately assessed the situation and began digging for the leaking part. He had it fixed in no time.  Everyone I have spoken to at this company, either live or over the phone, has been exceptionally courteous.

I am a single mother raising three children alone.  I just paid the funeral expenses for my father out of pocket.  There is not a lot of cash lying about at this time, and the issue with our plumbing was a humongous stressor on top of my father's loss and funeral expenses.  I can't begin to express how profoundly touched I was to encounter people who were kind, honest, and beyond reasonable.  I am not ashamed to say that I cried happy tears when I walked into my home and could run water without worrying about the leak and the rising water bill.  I will happily call on this company again when need arises, and I will be glad to recommend them to others.

name: Jennifer Templin

I am an HOA property manager and have used Keith the Plumber for many different types of jobs at many different communities I manage. They do a great job explaining what the issue is and correcting it in a timely manner. I highly recommend!

text: Trust me, just call them and be done calling folks! I called them about 3pm as I saw water flowing through my yard. They asked if I had water, to which I told them no that I had cut it off.  I told them I could make it until morning if needed and they asked to call me back, had already heard this from several places but no one called back for several hours later....within 30 minutes I not only had a call back, but it was worked out to have someone here that day! Then, not only did they fixed the leak at hand...they tested the pressure and found a faulty pressure regulator to be the culprit and fixed the root of the problem for me. I cannot say enough great stuff about their honesty, professionalism and work ethic for treating customers like they would want to be treated!

name: Tracey Fahey
text: Dennis came out and serviced our issue with our water heater today. EXQUISITE customer service. He explained it all to me and works quickly! I’m happy to recommend this company to others and give praise to hard working master plumbers like Dennis, thank you Keith the plumber!

name: Anne Stephens
text:
I had a leaking bathroom faucet and they charged me $175  ($225 including service fee) to change a $2 rubber gasket on a stem. They quoted me the price before even diagnosing the issue, stating, "we can make this stop dripping for $175". It was a 20 minute repair job and it did not solve the problem - still leaked. I requested them to come back because it wasn't fixed and all they did was the exact same repair. This did nothing, and the faucet still leaks to this day. The plumbers were not professional, did not wear masks, and did not want to take the time to accurately diagnose and fix the issue. Instead, they looked for the easiest and quickest "fix".  I ended up having to call another plumber who was able to correctly diagnose and explain the problem to me. I might as well have thrown $225 in the trash.

Not only did the plumber waste my money, but cost me HUNDREDS. During my initial request for service, I also requested that they re-install a center knob on a shower spa sprayer that came loose. It was installed a few years ago, and nothing technically was wrong with it - the center knob just needed to be re-installed. After taking apart the cover plate and fooling with it, they said it couldn't be fixed. They never diagnosed the issue or told me what was wrong with it, offering no solution. I hired a different plumber to look at it today and he said that the metal lip on the center valve is chipped and broken from someone trying to turn it excessively to remove it (it is one piece and can't be removed). It was installed a few years ago, and no one else has fooled with it except for them. So, they chipped it when fooling with it, which explains their reluctance to fix the problem. Now the entire unit has to be replaced, I have to cut a hole in my wall, and it is going to cost me hundreds of dollars. An honest or reliable plumber would have owned up to the mistake instead of trying to brush it off, and a knowledgeable one would have known better to begin with.

I honestly never leave bad reviews. I just think that other people should be warned before dealing with this company.

text: They installed our septic system that should have out lasted us, but I'll be reasonable It should have lasted at least 20 years.  It had to be a mound system, they asked if they could get top soil from our property,  because that would be cheaper. (Warning, if you need mound, that means your soil doesn't drain, getting soil from your own property is a bad idea) With in a year there were some cave in spots, the did come out and respect the warranty, but complained that we drove on it,  we did not drive on it.  When our septic field failed less that 5 years after it was installed, we called to see if they would come fix it. They said it wasn't under warranty and would not help us at all.  We knew it wasn't under warranty but the county septic engineer said we should contact them to come fix their work because they put it in they are familiar with it. They they asked where it was leaking,  and said if it was off the side it was our fault, (note I wasn't trying to place blame, I was trying to get help) The leak is on the top, close to where the main pipe should connect into the dome system.  I was then told I would save a LOT of money if we just had a load of land fill and put it on top, and that would "fix" the problem. I told that to the county engineer, and was informed that would be illegal, and just cause more problems, and we would be liable for an Illegal fix, for several reasons, 1- we are not licensed or certified to work on a septic field, even though it is our own. 2- we would not have pulled a permit for the fix, which if we ever sold the house and they found out about the fix we would be liable.  So very dishonest company.

I would recommend Roto-Rooter and/or Glenn Jennings to anyone with any plumbing/water/etc. issues. He is certainly an irreplaceable asset to any of Roto-Rooter’s potential customers. I will definitely call Roto-Rooter/Glenn Jennings first with any plumbing needs I have in the future. Needless to say, they both come HIGHLY recommended.
